persRole: ﻿Pastor of St. Mary's of the Woods

instName: ﻿St. Mary's Institute and Mother-House of the Sisters of Providence
instNote: ﻿The Sisters of Providence are employed in the education of youth, and in works of mercy. They conduct schools of both grades, common and high; have charge of orphans and invalids in hospitals of charity; they also visit the poort and indigent sick.

﻿The Mother House is situated at Oldenburgh, a pleasant village about three miles distant from Batesville Station, on the Indianapolis and Cincinnati Railroad. The members follow the rule of the Third Order of St. Francis for Conventuals, and devote themselves to the instruction of youth and the care of orphans. The Perpetual Adoration is practised in the chapel adjoining the monastery buildings.
affiliated: ﻿under charge of the Sisters of St. Francis.
